page.title: 20TILMANSTONE PIT _ COAL FACE
page.content: The Colliery has a{workforce}of 507 {surface}and{underground}staff.{Shifts start at 6am, 12 noon and 10pm, and are{7 1/4 hrs. underground,}or{8 hrs. on the{surface.}The 100 workers on each shift collect 2{security checks. They hand in one prior to descending in the lift; the other is kept until they return from the face. The{lift}takes miners down approx. {930m}at 300m per min., to within{3000m of the face; a{truck ride}follows, before a{600m walk}to the{coal face. The face has a total{height}of{1.4m, {roof supports}reduce this to 1.1m. {Conditions}are dark, dusty, warm and humid, but fair compared to other col_ lieries. Coal{output}is negligible following damage which occurred during the{Pit {Dispute}of 1984/85.{Closure}of the mine is almost certain to follow.
